meanings.definition: A person or thing that supports or uplifts.
meanings.sent1: The strong pillars in the building act as upbearers, holding up the roof.
meanings.sent2: The upbearers in the story helped the main character overcome his challenges.
meanings.sent3: The upbearers, like magical giants, lifted the spirits of everyone around them.
meanings.sent4: Her encouraging words were like upbearers, lifting him up when he felt down.
meanings.sent5: The upbearers of the community, always ready to lend a helping hand, were greatly appreciated.

meanings.definition: Plural form of upbearer: those who lift or elevate.
meanings.sent1: The upbearers in the team effortlessly lifted the heavy equipment.
meanings.sent2: As the upbearers of the group, they were always there to lend a hand.
meanings.sent3: The upbearers, like a team of superheroes, worked together to lift the fallen tree.
meanings.sent4: Their unity acted as upbearers, raising the team's morale to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The upbearers of the mountain, the strong climbers, reached the summit with determination.
